titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James J. Cleer papers 1864-1865
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Correspondence from a Union sailor on the U.S. Steamer Maratanza near Wilmington, N.C., to his parents. The sailor writes about an unsuccessful attack on Fort Fisher on Christmas Eve; and about a successful attack on Fort Fisher and describes the victory as "the greatest victory that has been gained since the war."

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: James J. Cleer Papers 1864-1865, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from a Union sailor on the U.S. Steamer Maratanza near Wilmington, N.C., to his parents. The sailor writes about an unsuccessful attack on Fort Fisher on Christmas Eve; and about a successful attack on Fort Fisher and describes the victory as "the greatest victory that has been gained since the war."

controlaccess.subject: USS Maratanza (Ship)
controlaccess.geogname: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Naval operations
